text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

Hello, my name is
Maggie Sanchez,

your host for this
exciting digital series,

"Pathways to Inclusive
Entrepreneurship."

As an alumna of HBS with
decades of experience,

driving innovation and high
tech, and an entrepreneur,

I'm all too familiar with many
of the needs and challenges

faced by female founders and
underestimated entrepreneurs.

Our aim is to stir
visionary thinking

and illuminate key
ideas about how
to create meaningful change.

Sharing key lessons learned
by educators, funders,

and founders, we will shed light
on some of the key disparities.
The facts are clear.

The US venture capital
industry invested

a record-breaking $329 billion
across more than 17,000 deals

Only 2% of this bonanza went
to startups founded solely

by women, the lowest
level since 2016.

Less than 4/1000 of a percent
the venture capital invested

in the first half of
2021 went to startups
with Black female founders.
The goal is ambitious.

This digital series will
feature three episodes.

In episode one, we
will reveal the state
of entrepreneurship and equity.

The second episode,
"Capital Creators,"

will feature a fantastic
group of funders,

dismantling some of
the key barriers.

And in the third episode,
"The Founder's Journey,"

we will hear personal
stories from entrepreneurs

about their triumphs
and challenges.
So tune in and join us.

Together, we will explore
different pathways
to inclusive entrepreneurship.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
